page.title: 09MRS WARWICK-STANION
page.content: Mrs Warwick has lived in Stanion for 76 years and she is 80.When she was 5 there were 2 shops; a sweet shop and a general store which is now the post office.The gift shop by the post office used to be a bakery shop and every day you could go and get your dinners heated for you.Every weekend you could go to the bakery shop and buy bread,buns and other food. In the yard of the Cardigan Arms there was a blacksmith and people from GEDDINGTON,BRIGSTOCK and LITTLE OAKLEY would come to get their horses shoed. When Mr Thomson used to teach in the old school there were one hundred pupils and three teachers.There were only two rooms used for classrooms. The small room was used for the infants,and they had one teacher and the bigger room was used for the { juniors with two teachers.
